trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about a specified named pipe

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information about a specified named pipe

target.mrk: Retrieves information about a specified named pipe

trans-unit.source: Handle to the server end of a named pipe instance

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the server end of a named pipe instance

target.mrk: Handle to the server end of a named pipe instance

trans-unit.source: an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: an array with the following format:

target.mrk: an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: $aState[0] - True if pipe handle is in nonblocking mode, otherwise blocking mode

seg-source.mrk: $aState[0] - True if pipe handle is in nonblocking mode, otherwise blocking mode

target.mrk: $aState[0] - True if pipe handle is in nonblocking mode, otherwise blocking mode

trans-unit.source: $aState[1] - True if pipe handle is in message-read mode, otherwise byte read mode

seg-source.mrk: $aState[1] - True if pipe handle is in message-read mode, otherwise byte read mode

target.mrk: $aState[1] - True if pipe handle is in message-read mode, otherwise byte read mode

trans-unit.source: $aState[3] - Maximum number of bytes to be collected on the client's computer before transmission

seg-source.mrk: $aState[3] - Maximum number of bytes to be collected on the client's computer before transmission

target.mrk: $aState[3] - Maximum number of bytes to be collected on the client's computer before transmission

trans-unit.source: $aState[4] - Maximum time, in milliseconds, that can pass before a remote named pipe transfers information over the network

seg-source.mrk: $aState[4] - Maximum time, in milliseconds, that can pass before a remote named pipe transfers information over the network

target.mrk: $aState[4] - Maximum time, in milliseconds, that can pass before a remote named pipe transfers information over the network

trans-unit.source: $aState[5] - User name string associated with the client application. The server can only retrieve this information if the client opened the pipe with the SECURITY_IMPERSONATION access privilege

seg-source.mrk: $aState[5] - User name string associated with the client application.
The server can only retrieve this information if the client opened the pipe with the SECURITY_IMPERSONATION access privilege

target.mrk: $aState[5] - User name string associated with the client application.
The server can only retrieve this information if the client opened the pipe with the SECURITY_IMPERSONATION access privilege
